article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_0_0 post-9100 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-notifications

img.alt: If you have a child that will be entering grades 2, 6, 9, or 12 next school year, you will be receiving information in the mail for your child’s health requirements, including physicals, exams, and vaccinations. Students entering kindergarten next school year have already received their information in the mail. REMEMBER: a sports physical does not count for the school physical for 6th and 9th grades.

h5.a: If you have a child that will be entering grades 2, 6, 9, or 12 next school year, you will be receiving information in the mail for your child’s health requirements, including physicals, exams, and vaccinations. Students entering kindergarten next school year have already received their information in the mail. REMEMBER: a sports physical does not count for the school physical for 6th and 9th grades.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_0_1 post-9095 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-notifications

img.alt: Starting Monday, April 20th, high school students should stop by the office and pick up bags containing the contents of their PE lockers. The office will be open daily from 8am-2pm.

h5.a: Starting Monday, April 20th, high school students should stop by the office and pick up bags containing the contents of their PE lockers. The office will be open daily from 8am-2pm.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_0_2 post-9085 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-notifications

img.alt: Governor Pritzker has announced that Illinois will continue its suspension of in-person instruction for another 30 days, through April 30. Illinois schools will remain closed until April 30 and students will return on May 1. We will notify our students and families if and when there are any changes to the May 1 return date. In the meantime, we will continue to provide meal service and remote educational engagement to the best of our ability. Events that have been scheduled through April 30 are cancelled. We realize that this includes high school prom and will do our best to find a way to offer that experience when it has been deemed safe to return to school. Our sincere thanks to our school community, students and families for their understanding and patience. We miss our students and anxiously await the time when we can return to school.

h5.a: Governor Pritzker has announced that Illinois will continue its suspension of in-person instruction for another 30 days, through April 30. Illinois schools will remain closed until April 30 and students will return on May 1. We will notify our students and families if and when there are any changes to the May 1 return date. In the meantime, we will continue to provide meal service and remote educational engagement to the best of our ability. Events that have been scheduled through April 30 are cancelled. We realize that this includes high school prom and will do our best to find a way to offer that experience when it has been deemed safe to return to school. Our sincere thanks to our school community, students and families for their understanding and patience. We miss our students and anxiously await the time when we can return to school.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_0_3 post-9080 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-notifications

img.alt: Seniors can come to the office today before 2pm to pick up their caps, gowns, and graduation announcements. We will deliver them to the door near the front office.

h5.a: Seniors can come to the office today before 2pm to pick up their caps, gowns, and graduation announcements. We will deliver them to the door near the front office.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_0_4 post-9073 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-notifications

img.alt: Good afternoon. We have received some phone calls asking for clarification about the length of the school closure, so we felt it was best to contact everyone. All Illinois Schools will be closed for the remainder of the duration of the governor’s disaster proclamation, which currently extends through April 7, 2020. Currently, we plan to return to normal operation on April 8, 2020. We will do our best to update our school community if and when there are any changes to the scheduled date of return. In the meantime, we will continue to provide meal deliveries and do our best to remain in contact with our students and families. We thank you for your understanding and appreciate your support.

h5.a: Good afternoon. We have received some phone calls asking for clarification about the length of the school closure, so we felt it was best to contact everyone. All Illinois Schools will be closed for the remainder of the duration of the governor’s disaster proclamation, which currently extends through April 7, 2020. Currently, we plan to return to normal operation on April 8, 2020. We will do our best to update our school community if and when there are any changes to the scheduled date of return. In the meantime, we will continue to provide meal deliveries and do our best to remain in contact with our students and families. We thank you for your understanding and appreciate your support.
